image_2.description: Marla, whose real name is Mariam Dosso, is a 19-year-old rapper from Ivory Coast who uses a mix of French, Ivorian slang, and English in her performances, influencing the French language with her unique style.
Jean Patrick Niambé, known as Dofy, is a 24-year-old Ivorian hip-hop artist who contributes to the evolution of the French language by creating words from his own realities.

Souleymane Bachir Diagne is a renowned Senegalese professor of philosophy and French at Columbia University, commenting on the evolution of French in Africa and how this creolized French finds its way into various aspects of culture.

Ivory Coast is a country in Africa where French is spoken and is experiencing a surge in the youth population, influencing the French language. It is also mentioned as a place where the French language is changing, with Abidjan being the largest city in Ivory Coast and a significant location for this linguistic evolution.

Africa is the continent where French is spoken by a majority and is experiencing a surge in the youth population, influencing the French language. More than 60 percent of those who speak French daily now live in Africa, and 80 percent of children studying in French are in Africa.

Senegal is a country in Africa where French is spoken and is mentioned as a location for the changing French language. It is also home to Souleymane Bachir Diagne, a renowned professor of philosophy and French at Columbia University.
The Democratic Republic of Congo is a country in Africa with a significant French-speaking population. Its capital, Kinshasa, has as many French speakers as Paris.
Paris is mentioned as a city with a significant French-speaking population, comparable to Kinshasa in the Democratic Republic of Congo.

image_3.description: Free-ranging domestic cats, including feral ones, are known for their predatory behavior and have a significant impact on wildlife, devouring over 2,000 species. They are also depicted in an image where a cat is holding a small green lizard in its mouth, showcasing their role as predators.
